poem:
### Lardy Legacy

In Maiden Newton's quiet past,  
where tins sat snug and dough did rise,  
a lardy cake would hold steadfast,  
rich layers set in buttery guise.  

No modern sourdough or sweet disguise,  
just a memory baked in sugared trance,  
an unapologetic slice of skies,  
the spirit of indulgence in its dance.
